Kemmanagundi is a scenic hill station in the Baba Budan Giri range of hills. Karnataka's tallest peak, Mullayanagiri, is also part of the same hill ranges. 55 kms to the north of Chikmagalur, Kemmanagundi is also known as KR hills after the Wodeyar king Krishna Raja Wodeyar who made it his favourite summer camp. Located at a height of 1434 meters, it is amazingly verdant and has beautiful climate throughout the year.

. Tarikere is about 15 km from Kemmannagundi and taxi will cost about Rs 300 from railway station to Kemmannagundi. For train timings and on-line reservations (within India) visit the Indian Railways Catering and Tourism Corporation's website

Kemmannagundi is well connected by bus services. Private and public transport buses connect frequently to Tarikere (30 km), Chikmagalur (55 km), Bangalore (295 km) and Mangalore (190 km). A/C deluxe and luxury buses are available from Bangalore and Mangalore to Kemmannagundi, which cost about Rs 4 per km.
